HEADLINE: D2X Raises ‚Ç¨4.3M from Circle, CMT Digital to Expand Institutional Crypto Derivatives
SUMMARY: Amsterdam-based crypto derivatives exchange D2X has secured ‚Ç¨4.3 million in fresh funding from a lineup of heavyweight backers, including CMT Digital, Circle Ventures, and Canton Ventures. Key Takeaways: D2X has raised ‚Ç¨4.3M to expand its institutional crypto derivatives platform. The exchange operates under a MiFID-regulated license. D2X offers seven-day trading for BTC and ETH futures. The capital injection will fuel product development and support onboarding for institutional clients seeking a regulated path into crypto derivatives trading, according to a report from Silicon Canals . ‚ÄúWith its MTF license and weekend-ready architecture, D2X addresses two major gaps in Europe: regulated venues and access to 24/7 crypto markets,‚Äù said Charlie Sandor, Investment Partner at CMT Digital. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre proud to support a team that‚Äôs setting a new benchmark for institutional crypto trading.‚Äù D2X Secures Follow-On Support from Point72, Tioga, GSR, and Fortino The round also drew participation from existing investors including Point72 Ventures, Tioga Capital, GSR, and Fortino Capital. It follows D2X‚Äôs ‚Ç¨9.1 million Series A funding raised in 2023, which coincided with the exchange becoming the first in the EU to receive a MiFID-compliant Multilateral Trading Facility (MTF) license for crypto derivatives, granted by the Dutch Authority for Financial Markets (AFM). Founded by Theodore Rozencwajg, Don van der Krogt, and Laetitia Grimaud, D2X is focused exclusively on institutional-grade crypto derivatives. The company‚Äôs product lineup currently includes USD- and EUR-denominated Bitcoin and Ethereum futures, with options trading expected to launch shortly. Its infrastructure supports seven-day trading while remaining fully compliant with MiFID II regulations, a model designed to mirror the around-the-clock nature of crypto markets while offering the safeguards traditional financial institutions expect. D2X $5M Strategic Round About: D2X is a platform that provides trading of cryptocurrency derivatives. Investors: @GSR_io , @CMT_Digital , @circle_ventures , @TiogaCapital , @p72vc , and @FortinoCapital https://t.co/26auSn7Vep pic.twitter.com/4ahpKXQcwR ‚Äî Fundraising Digest (@CryptoRank_VCs) July 29, 2025 The firm‚Äôs latest launch, USD-based futures for BTC and ETH, caters to growing institutional demand for dollar-settled instruments in a regulatory-compliant setting. ‚ÄúThis funding allows us to enhance our product suite and accelerate the onboarding of Tier-1 institutions,‚Äù said Rozencwajg. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre building for those who require a trusted, transparent, and regulated trading venue.‚Äù With MiFID-regulated status, real-time USD exposure, and a compliance-first approach, D2X is positioning itself as a European leader in institutional crypto derivatives. Coinbase Launches Regulated Perpetual Futures for US Retail Traders Last week, Coinbase introduced CFTC-regulated nano Bitcoin and Ethereum perpetual futures , giving US retail traders access to up to 10x leverage within a compliant onshore framework. Offered through Coinbase Financial Markets, the contracts come with low taker fees starting at 0.02% and replicate traditional perps, featuring five-year expirations and hourly funding rates. Settled in USD, the new products trade 24/7 and aim to bring U.S. users back from offshore platforms. Perpetual futures dominate global crypto derivatives trading, but American traders have long been pushed to riskier offshore venues due to regulatory hurdles. Coinbase‚Äôs launch marks a shift, providing legal access to leverage while aligning with Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) standards. The move is part of a broader trend as US exchanges , including Kraken, ramp up their regulated derivatives offerings. The post D2X Raises ‚Ç¨4.3M from Circle, CMT Digital to Expand Institutional Crypto Derivatives appeared first on Cryptonews .

HEADLINE: Corporate Ethereum Treasuries Could Hit 10% of Supply, Says Standard Chartered
SUMMARY: The post Corporate Ethereum Treasuries Could Hit 10% of Supply, Says Standard Chartered appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News Ethereum is entering a new phase of institutional adoption. From treasury strategies to bullish price targets, it is getting serious attention from corporate and financial players. As per a recent report from Standard Chartered, institutional treasuries now hold around 1% of ETH‚Äôs total circulating supply. But that‚Äôs just the beginning. The bank believes that this could grow tenfold, with businesses eventually holding up to 10% of ETH‚Äôs total supply. Ethereum Gains Edge Over Bitcoin Corporate ETH buying and spot Ether ETF inflows are both on the rise. According to data from Sosovalue , the cumulative total net inflow for spot ether ETFs has reached $9.40 billion. $ETH ETF inflow + $65,200,000 yesterday. Blackrock bought $130,200,000 Ethereum. pic.twitter.com/EIzLYMHvbG ‚Äî Ted (@TedPillows) July 29, 2025 The rise in interest has likely played a big role in ETH outperforming Bitcoin recently. The ETH/BTC ratio has jumped from 0.018 in April to 0.032 in July. Geoff Kendrick, analyst at Standard Chartered, notes that this could spark the start of a bigger shift, where institutions begin favoring Ethereum more heavily in their digital asset portfolios, even over Bitcoin. Is ETH More Attractive Than BTC? Ethereum is emerging as a more useful treasury asset than Bitcoin. While Bitcoin is often held for its scarcity, Ethereum offers the added benefits of staking rewards, currently around 3%, along with access to DeFi tools that can boost returns. In regions with strict crypto regulations, Ethereum also stands out. The report suggests that ETH can serve as a smart workaround for companies that want crypto exposure on their balance sheets but face regulatory limitations. That makes ETH a more flexible option for publicly listed firms. Staking Brings Rewards and Risks However, a Bernstein report highlights how Ethereum treasuries are taking a different approach than Bitcoin-focused ones. Instead of just holding ETH, companies are staking it to earn yield and boost earnings. But this strategy isn‚Äôt without risks. There are liquidity delays when unstaking, and tools like restaking or DeFi protocols introduce smart contract risks that traditional assets don‚Äôt face. Companies like BitMine, SharpLink, and Bit Digital have accumulated over 876,000 ETH in July, with BitMine alone crossing $2 billion in ETH and aiming for 5% the total supply. Bernstein sees Ethereum gaining long-term value from its growing ecosystem. Will Ethereum Cross $4,000? Analysts Debate Ethereum briefly crossed $3,900 on Monday, its highest since December 2024, before pulling back. It has surged over 50% in the past month. Standard Chartered has maintained its $4,000 target for Ethereum, while analysts expect it to break its previous all-time high of $4,800 this year. BitMEX founder Arthur Hayes even sees it hitting $10,000. Meanwhile, Tom Lee‚Äôs Bitmine projected an eye-popping $60,000 target. $ETH has broken out of its short-term consolidation phase. First time it happened, ETH pumped 25% in a week. 2nd time it happened, ETH pumped 30% in a week. From treasury strategies to bullish price targets, it is getting serious attention from corporate and financial players. As per a recent report from Standard Chartered, institutional treasuries now hold around 1% of ETH‚Äôs total circulating supply. But that‚Äôs just the beginning. The bank believes that this could grow tenfold, with businesses eventually holding up to 10% of ETH‚Äôs total supply. Ethereum Gains Edge Over Bitcoin Corporate ETH buying and spot Ether ETF inflows are both on the rise. According to data from Sosovalue , the cumulative total net inflow for spot ether ETFs has reached $9.40 billion. $ETH ETF inflow + $65,200,000 yesterday. Blackrock bought $130,200,000 Ethereum. pic.twitter.com/EIzLYMHvbG ‚Äî Ted (@TedPillows) July 29, 2025 The rise in interest has likely played a big role in ETH outperforming Bitcoin recently. The ETH/BTC ratio has jumped from 0.018 in April to 0.032 in July. Geoff Kendrick, analyst at Standard Chartered, notes that this could spark the start of a bigger shift, where institutions begin favoring Ethereum more heavily in their digital asset portfolios, even over Bitcoin. Is ETH More Attractive Than BTC? Ethereum is emerging as a more useful treasury asset than Bitcoin. While Bitcoin is often held for its scarcity, Ethereum offers the added benefits of staking rewards, currently around 3%, along with access to DeFi tools that can boost returns. In regions with strict crypto regulations, Ethereum also stands out. The report suggests that ETH can serve as a smart workaround for companies that want crypto exposure on their balance sheets but face regulatory limitations. That makes ETH a more flexible option for publicly listed firms. Instead of just holding ETH, companies are staking it to earn yield and boost earnings. But this strategy isn‚Äôt without risks. There are liquidity delays when unstaking, and tools like restaking or DeFi protocols introduce smart contract risks that traditional assets don‚Äôt face. Companies like BitMine, SharpLink, and Bit Digital have accumulated over 876,000 ETH in July, with BitMine alone crossing $2 billion in ETH and aiming for 5% the total supply. Bernstein sees Ethereum gaining long-term value from its growing ecosystem. Will Ethereum Cross $4,000? HEADLINE: Crypto Lender Abra Secretly Pauses Withdrawals, Customers Fear $700M Platform Collapse
SUMMARY: Crypto lender Abra has quietly paused withdrawals for international customers without public announcement, sparking fears of another major platform collapse similar to Celsius and BlockFi as desperate users flood social media demanding access to their frozen funds. According to DLNew , the platform, which claims to manage over $700 million in customer assets, notified some users via email on July 19 that ‚Äú Abra Earn international services are currently paused, effective immediately ‚Äù due to ‚Äú broader risk management efforts ‚Äù and ‚Äú external circumstances outside of our control. ‚Äú Silent Crisis Unfolds as CEO Continues Public Promotion Customers report being unable to withdraw funds for several weeks, with support representatives cutting them off and ignoring requests for explanations. Users have taken to social media platforms to plead directly with CEO Bill Barhydt, who continues promoting the company while avoiding customer inquiries. Source: Comments under Barhydt‚Äôs X post The crisis emerged just over a year after Abra reached settlements with 25 US states requiring $82 million in customer refunds for operating without proper licenses. The platform previously faced insolvency allegations from Texas regulators in 2023, who claimed Abra had been insolvent since March 2023. Customer reports of missed payments and withdrawal issues began appearing online in early June, with affected users describing zero yields on accounts that previously generated returns. Source: Comments under the company‚Äôs X post The situation recalls the collapse of major crypto lenders, including Celsius and BlockFi , in 2022. Speculatively, Abra appears to offer high yields through unsecured lending and DeFi activities. The platform recently launched new services targeting institutional clients and high-net-worth individuals, but it is facing mounting customer service failures. Pattern of Regulatory Violations and Financial Distress Abra‚Äôs current crisis follows years of regulatory violations and financial difficulties across multiple jurisdictions. In June 2023, the Texas State Securities Board accused the platform of securities fraud , alleging Abra misled investors while operating in a state of insolvency or near-insolvency. Texas regulators claimed Abra secretly transferred over $118 million in digital assets to Binance while concealing financial information about loan defaults and asset transfers. The board alleged Abra held $30 million in failed lender Babel Finance, $30 million in Genesis, and $10 million in collapsed Three Arrows Capital. The platform reached a $82.1 million settlement with 25 US states in June 2024 for operating without required money transmission licenses. Under the agreement, CEO Bill Barhydt was personally barred from involvement in money transmission services within those states for five years. The UK‚Äôs Financial Conduct Authority warned in November 2023 that Abra was not authorized to offer services in the country and advised against dealing with the firm. Georgia‚Äôs Banking and Finance Department ordered Barhydt to be personally liable for returning funds to US customers. The SEC settled charges against Abra in August 2024 for improperly marketing Abra Earn as an unregistered security. At its peak, Abra Earn managed approximately $600 million in assets, with nearly $500 million from US investors before the program was phased out. Multiple state investigations revealed Abra offered crypto transactions through its mobile app without the necessary licenses, leading to the forced cessation of US operations and customer fund returns. International Customers Left Without Recourse as Platform Struggles The current withdrawal pause appears to affect only international customers, with unclear reasons for the geographic limitation. Alan, a customer from Guatemala, reported through DLNews being unable to access $1,200 deposited on the platform after noticing zero yields on previously interest-bearing accounts. Customer service responses have become increasingly generic, with official Abra accounts providing stock responses offering little guidance or help. Recent Trustpilot reviews describe representatives cutting off communications and ignoring fund access requests entirely. CEO Barhydt continues to appear on podcasts and post multiple times daily on social media, while customers plead for responses in the comment sections. The disconnect between promotional activities and customer service failures has intensified user frustration and concern. The platform‚Äôs claimed $700 million in managed assets represents significant customer exposure if withdrawal restrictions persist or expand. Unlike previous crypto lender collapses that affected primarily US customers, international users may have limited regulatory recourse. In mid-2024, Abra launched Abra Prime and Abra Private platforms for institutional and high-net-worth clients while simultaneously struggling to serve existing retail customers. The platform also introd

HEADLINE: U.S. Stock Markets: Decoding the Day‚Äôs Crucial Mixed Signals
SUMMARY: BitcoinWorld U.S. Stock Markets: Decoding the Day‚Äôs Crucial Mixed Signals In the dynamic world of global finance, the opening bell on Wall Street often sets the tone for investor sentiment across various asset classes, including the rapidly evolving cryptocurrency market. Today, U.S. stock markets presented a mixed picture, a scenario that often prompts investors to pause and consider the underlying currents influencing their portfolios. While some indices edged higher, others experienced a slight dip, painting a complex canvas for the day‚Äôs trading. Understanding the Nuances of a Mixed Opening for U.S. Stock Markets When we talk about U.S. stock markets opening ‚Äòmixed,‚Äô it signifies a divergence in performance among the major indices. This isn‚Äôt just a random fluctuation; it often reflects varied investor perceptions about different sectors of the economy or specific company prospects. Let‚Äôs break down what today‚Äôs numbers reveal: S&P 500: +0.22% ‚Äì As a broad measure of large-cap U.S. equities, the S&P 500‚Äôs modest gain suggests a general, albeit cautious, positive sentiment across a wide range of industries. This index is often seen as a bellwether for the overall health of the U.S. economy. NASDAQ: +0.56% ‚Äì The technology-heavy NASDAQ Composite showed a more robust gain. This performance often indicates investor confidence in growth stocks, particularly those in the technology, biotechnology, and internet sectors. A strong NASDAQ can sometimes signal a ‚Äòrisk-on‚Äô appetite, where investors are willing to embrace higher-growth, potentially higher-risk assets. Dow Jones: -0.01% ‚Äì Conversely, the Dow Jones Industrial Average, which comprises 30 significant U.S. blue-chip companies, registered a slight dip. This index is often viewed as a reflection of traditional industrial and established corporate America. A minor decline here, while seemingly insignificant, can suggest a cautious approach towards value stocks or a slight rotation out of more mature industries. The table below summarizes today‚Äôs opening: Index Performance Primary Focus S&P 500 +0.22% Broad market, large-cap equities NASDAQ +0.56% Technology and growth companies Dow Jones -0.01% Industrial and blue-chip companies Why Are the U.S. Stock Markets Displaying Mixed Signals? A mixed opening is rarely arbitrary; it typically stems from a confluence of macroeconomic factors, corporate news, and investor psychology. Understanding these drivers is key to interpreting the market‚Äôs behavior: Economic Data Releases: Investors are constantly reacting to fresh economic data. This could include inflation reports, unemployment figures, manufacturing indices, or consumer confidence surveys. Positive data in one area might boost certain sectors, while weaker data elsewhere could weigh on others. For instance, strong tech earnings might lift NASDAQ, even if broader economic concerns dampen the Dow. Federal Reserve Policy Expectations: The anticipation of interest rate changes or shifts in monetary policy from the Federal Reserve can significantly impact market sentiment. Higher interest rates typically make borrowing more expensive, which can affect corporate profits and growth stock valuations more acutely than established, dividend-paying companies. Corporate Earnings Reports: Individual company earnings can create sector-specific movements. A stellar report from a major tech company could propel the NASDAQ, while a disappointing outlook from an industrial giant might pull down the Dow, even if the broader S&P 500 remains relatively stable. Geopolitical Developments: Global events, such as international conflicts, trade disputes, or political instability, can introduce uncertainty into the markets. These factors often lead to a ‚Äòflight to safety‚Äô in some assets while increasing volatility in others, contributing to a mixed performance. Sector Rotation: Sometimes, a mixed market indicates a ‚Äòsector rotation,‚Äô where investors are shifting capital from one industry or type of stock to another, based on changing economic outlooks or investment themes. For example, moving from defensive stocks to growth stocks, or vice versa. The Ripple Effect: How U.S. Stock Markets Influence Cryptocurrency For cryptocurrency enthusiasts and investors, the performance of U.S. stock markets is far from an isolated event. There‚Äôs a growing correlation between traditional financial markets and the crypto space, particularly with bellwether assets like Bitcoin and Ethereum. Here‚Äôs why: Risk-On/Risk-Off Sentiment: When traditional markets, especially growth-oriented indices like the NASDAQ, perform well, it often signals a ‚Äòrisk-on‚Äô environment. In such periods, investors are generally more willing to allocate capital to higher-risk, higher-reward assets, including cryptocurrencies. Conversely, a ‚Äòrisk-off‚Äô environment, often triggered by uncertainty in traditional markets, can lead to a withdrawal of capital from riskier assets, impacting crypto prices negatively. Institutional Adopt

HEADLINE: The Company with the Most Ethereum Has Made an Incredible ETH Price Prediction!
SUMMARY: The treasury strategy for Ethereum (ETH) has seen a huge boom recently, with BitMine Immersion Technologies becoming the largest institutional ETH holder. The company holds more than $2 billion worth of Ethereum. BitMine Chairman Tom Lee''s ‚ÄúExecutive Message‚Äù video series, designed to inform investors about Ethereum''s long-term bullish potential, has released an incredible price prediction for ETH. At this point, BitMine claimed that the Ethereum price could be $60,000 based on reliable research from numerous firms. In its post, Bitmine stated that they consulted with numerous research firms to estimate Ethereum''s potential value. The firms used a ‚Äúreserve value‚Äù model to assess Ethereum''s value in terms of payment systems and payment volumes, and estimated the total network value to be $7 trillion. Since Ethereum currently has a network value of only $0.4 trillion and a price around $3,800, the analysis suggests that Ethereum has the potential for an 18x increase and its price could be around $60,000. While this prediction aligns with the company''s ETH treasury strategies, it''s not considered an achievable price target in the short term, as Tom Lee predicts Ethereum could reach around $15,000 by the end of the year. Related News: Tom Lee, who predicted the previous bull market, announced his new predictions for Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH)! He gave the date! *This is not investment advice. HEADLINE: Twenty One Capital Unveils Massive Bitcoin Holdings Boost
SUMMARY: BitcoinWorld Twenty One Capital Unveils Massive Bitcoin Holdings Boost The cryptocurrency world is buzzing with significant news as Twenty One Capital, an emerging player in the digital asset space, is set to make a colossal addition to its Bitcoin holdings . This strategic move, involving a substantial transfer of 5,800 BTC from Tether, is poised to elevate Twenty One Capital‚Äôs total Bitcoin reserves to an impressive 43,500 BTC before its highly anticipated listing. This development isn‚Äôt just a number; it‚Äôs a powerful statement about institutional confidence in Bitcoin‚Äôs long-term value and an event that warrants a closer look for anyone keen on understanding the evolving landscape of digital finance. What‚Äôs Driving This Significant Boost in Bitcoin Holdings ? The core of this exciting news comes from a report by @cryptounfolded on X, indicating that Twenty One Capital expects to receive an additional 5,800 BTC from Tether. This infusion will significantly bolster their existing reserves, pushing their total Bitcoin holdings to at least 43,500 BTC. To put this into perspective, such a substantial accumulation places Twenty One Capital among a growing cohort of publicly traded companies that are embracing Bitcoin as a core treasury asset. This move is particularly noteworthy as it precedes Twenty One Capital‚Äôs planned listing. Acquiring a significant amount of Bitcoin before going public can serve multiple strategic purposes: Strengthening the Balance Sheet: A robust Bitcoin reserve can be viewed as a strong asset, enhancing the company‚Äôs financial standing and appeal to potential investors. Signaling Conviction: It sends a clear message to the market about the company‚Äôs long-term belief in Bitcoin‚Äôs value proposition and its role in the future of finance. Capitalizing on Market Opportunities: Strategic accumulation before a listing might suggest a belief in future appreciation, positioning the company to benefit from Bitcoin‚Äôs growth. This isn‚Äôt merely a transaction; it‚Äôs a strategic maneuver designed to optimize the company‚Äôs position in the rapidly evolving digital asset economy. The Strategic Play: Why Twenty One Capital is Doubling Down on Bitcoin Holdings In an era where digital assets are increasingly gaining mainstream acceptance, companies like Twenty One Capital are recognizing Bitcoin not just as a speculative asset, but as a legitimate store of value and a potential hedge against traditional market volatility and inflation. Their decision to significantly increase their Bitcoin holdings reflects several key strategic considerations: 1. Embracing the Digital Gold Narrative: Bitcoin has cemented its reputation as ‚Äòdigital gold,‚Äô offering a decentralized, finite supply that stands in stark contrast to fiat currencies subject to inflation. For companies seeking long-term asset preservation, Bitcoin presents an attractive alternative. 2. Attracting Crypto-Savvy Investors: In the current market, institutional investors and even retail participants are increasingly looking for companies with exposure to digital assets. A substantial Bitcoin treasury can make a company more appealing to a new generation of investors who understand and value the potential of cryptocurrencies. 3. Pioneering Future Financial Models: By holding significant Bitcoin, Twenty One Capital positions itself at the forefront of financial innovation. This could open doors to new business models, services, or partnerships built around digital assets, differentiating them from traditional firms. 4. Diversification of Treasury Assets: While traditional corporate treasuries primarily hold cash and short-term debt, a growing number of forward-thinking companies are diversifying into Bitcoin. This strategy aims to optimize returns and protect against the erosion of purchasing power, particularly in times of economic uncertainty. This calculated expansion of their Bitcoin holdings underscores a broader trend of institutional adoption, where companies are not just dipping their toes but diving headfirst into the digital asset ocean. Tether‚Äôs Role: A Deeper Look into the Bitcoin Holdings Transfer The involvement of Tether in this transaction adds another layer of intrigue. Tether, primarily known as the issuer of USDT, the largest stablecoin by market capitalization, also holds significant reserves in various assets, including Bitcoin. The report indicates that Twenty One Capital will ‚Äòreceive‚Äô 5,800 BTC ‚Äòfrom‚Äô Tether, suggesting Tether is the direct counterparty in this transfer. This could imply a few scenarios: Strategic Divestment from Tether‚Äôs Reserves: Tether holds substantial Bitcoin as part of its non-stablecoin reserves. This transfer could be a strategic move to rebalance their portfolio or facilitate a transaction with a key partner like Twenty One Capital. text: Twenty One Capital Unveils Massive Bitcoin Holdings Boost. BitcoinWorld Twenty One Capital Unveils Massive Bitcoin Holdings Boost The cryptocurrency world is buzzing with significant news as Twenty One Capital, an emerging player in the digital asset space, is set to make a colossal addition to its Bitcoin holdings . This strategic move, involving a substantial transfer of 5,800 BTC from Tether, is poised to elevate Twenty One Capital‚Äôs total Bitcoin reserves to an impressive 43,500 BTC before its highly anticipated listing. This development isn‚Äôt just a number; it‚Äôs a powerful statement about institutional confidence in Bitcoin‚Äôs long-term value and an event that warrants a closer look for anyone keen on understanding the evolving landscape of digital finance. What‚Äôs Driving This Significant Boost in Bitcoin Holdings ? The core of this exciting news comes from a report by @cryptounfolded on X, indicating that Twenty One Capital expects to receive an additional 5,800 BTC from Tether. This infusion will significantly bolster their existing reserves, pushing their total Bitcoin holdings to at least 43,500 BTC. To put this into perspective, such a substantial accumulation places Twenty One Capital among a growing cohort of publicly traded companies that are embracing Bitcoin as a core treasury asset. This move is particularly noteworthy as it precedes Twenty One Capital‚Äôs planned listing. Acquiring a significant amount of Bitcoin before going public can serve multiple strategic purposes: Strengthening the Balance Sheet: A robust Bitcoin reserve can be viewed as a strong asset, enhancing the company‚Äôs financial standing and appeal to potential investors. Signaling Conviction: It sends a clear message to the market about the company‚Äôs long-term belief in Bitcoin‚Äôs value proposition and its role in the future of finance. Capitalizing on Market Opportunities: Strategic accumulation before a listing might suggest a belief in future appreciation, positioning the company to benefit from Bitcoin‚Äôs growth. This isn‚Äôt merely a transaction; it‚Äôs a strategic maneuver designed to optimize the company‚Äôs position in the rapidly evolving digital asset economy. The Strategic Play: Why Twenty One Capital is Doubling Down on Bitcoin Holdings In an era where digital assets are increasingly gaining mainstream acceptance, companies like Twenty One Capital are recognizing Bitcoin not just as a speculative asset, but as a legitimate store of value and a potential hedge against traditional market volatility and inflation. Their decision to significantly increase their Bitcoin holdings reflects several key strategic considerations: 1. Embracing the Digital Gold Narrative: Bitcoin has cemented its reputation as ‚Äòdigital gold,‚Äô offering a decentralized, finite supply that stands in stark contrast to fiat currencies subject to inflation. For companies seeking long-term asset preservation, Bitcoin presents an attractive alternative. 2. Attracting Crypto-Savvy Investors: In the current market, institutional investors and even retail participants are increasingly looking for companies with exposure to digital assets. A substantial Bitcoin treasury can make a company more appealing to a new generation of investors who understand and value the potential of cryptocurrencies. 3. Pioneering Future Financial Models: By holding significant Bitcoin, Twenty One Capital positions itself at the forefront of financial innovation. This could open doors to new business models, services, or partnerships built around digital assets, differentiating them from traditional firms. 4. Diversification of Treasury Assets: While traditional corporate treasuries primarily hold cash and short-term debt, a growing number of forward-thinking companies are diversifying into Bitcoin. This strategy aims to optimize returns and protect against the erosion of purchasing power, particularly in times of economic uncertainty. This calculated expansion of their Bitcoin holdings underscores a broader trend of institutional adoption, where companies are not just dipping their toes but diving headfirst into the digital asset ocean. Tether‚Äôs Role: A Deeper Look into the Bitcoin Holdings Transfer The involvement of Tether in this transaction adds another layer of intrigue. Tether, primarily known as the issuer of USDT, the largest stablecoin by market capitalization, also holds significant reserves in various assets, including Bitcoin. The report indicates that Twenty One Capital will ‚Äòreceive‚Äô 5,800 BTC ‚Äòfrom‚Äô Tether, suggesting Tether is the direct counterparty in this transfer. This could imply a few scenarios: Strategic Divestment from Tether‚Äôs Reserves: Tether holds substantial Bitcoin as part of its non-stablecoin reserves. This transfer could be a strategic move to rebalance their portfolio or facilitate a transaction with a key partner like Twenty One Capital. HEADLINE: Strong Momentum On Bitcoin? Then I Choose FBTC
SUMMARY: Summary FBTC is among the most liquid and tightest bid/ask spread spot ETFs on BTC, but not the cheapest. This makes it suitable for faster trading contexts and sets it apart from solutions like BTC or HODL. I remain bullish because Bitcoin is showing increasing alignment with risk-on assets (like the Nasdaq), and less with safe haven assets like gold. Trump‚Äôs victories in the trade arena could create fertile ground for risk-on assets, and potentially for Bitcoin as well. An altseason also seems to be emerging, driven by the institutionalization of crypto, which could bring increased volatility. The Fidelity Wise Origin Bitcoin Fund ETF ( FBTC ) is not the most cost-effective, but it is definitely the most talked about/appreciated. And this is something I‚Äôve especially noticed among traders and short-term operators. There‚Äôs a tendency to prefer FBTC over possibly cheaper solutions. In fact, among the spot Bitcoin funds, it has one of the highest AUMs, and in my peer table, it ranks second only to IBIT. FBTC - IBIT: Profile (Seeking Alpha) It caught my attention, and from the ETF analysis, an interesting and indeed distinctive factor emerged: a reduced bid-ask spread and a minimal premium discount (1m rolling avg). But the question naturally arises: if the horizon shifts to the very short/short/medium term, what is the right approach to FBTC? Personally, I still tend to have a bullish view, as a consequence of my strictly momentum-oriented approach when working in the short term (those who follow me know that in the long term I tend to favor the quality aspect instead). The reason? The triumph of risk-on, thanks to the achievements reached by President Donald Trump in the trade arena. But also the positive evolution of the institutional narrative, with the GENIUS Act , which seems to align Bitcoin‚Äôs price action more and more with the Nasdaq-100, rather than with gold and the concept of a safe haven asset. But before that ‚Ä¶ What is FBTC? FBTC is the Spot ETF proposed by Fidelity Investments on Bitcoin, 100% backed by physical bitcoin (no derivatives, no leverage), with Fidelity Digital Asset Services (FDAS) as the custodian and custody mainly in cold storage with dynamic allocation (target >98%). And let‚Äôs be honest, it‚Äôs not the first, nor the last solution launched by investment firms to take part in the ‚ÄúBitcoin rush.‚Äù What we can ask ourselves is: is it the best? Well, it has an expense ratio of 0.25%; so it‚Äôs definitely not the cheapest. Fees are paid in bitcoin: the number of BTC per share decreases over time. However, it has a 30-day average bid/ask spread of +0.01% and Premium/Discount (1m rolling avg): +0.01%. FBTC - Expense Grade (Seeking Alpha) Not surprisingly, I notice it‚Äôs the preferred instrument among my colleagues for spot operations, or even daily or swing trading. This is because it‚Äôs fairly representative of BTC‚Äôs price in the short term, considering that the calculation method is the Volume-Weighted Median Price (VWMP) every 15 seconds , over rolling 60-minute windows. Peer: It has an AUM (Assets Under Management) of $23.99 billion, so we definitely can‚Äôt say it‚Äôs not appreciated in the market: not by chance, only 30% of the ownership distribution is institutional; almost 70% is public retail, probably attracted by the Fidelity brand and its interoperability. Even though there are alternatives in the market, some would call them ‚Äúbetter‚Äù: first of all, HODL and BTC have lower costs. And IBIT has higher AUM and volumes. FBTC - IBIT - BTC - HODL: Profile (Seeking Alpha) The result? Practically, short-term performance is very similar. The difference in expense ratio could generate a divergence in the long run, which leads me to prefer BTC or HODL for long-term portfolio solutions. But considering liquidity parameters, like the bid/ask spread and the relationship with NAV, FBTC remains a hot pick in my opinion (as, to some extent, does IBIT). And I must admit that among the prop trading community, it‚Äôs very much appreciated in this sense. FBTC - IBIT - HODL - BTC : Liquidity and expense grade (Seeking Alpha) Outlook for FBTC When it comes to the short term, I like to think like a CTA: with trend-following strategies. And in the short term, I embrace momentum as a winning strategy. And today, BTC-USD has a strongly positive momentum. The same quant rating is STRONG BUY, and here we know that trading such tickers statistically generates alpha. FBTC - Quant rating (Seeking Alpha) What drives FBTC‚Äôs positive momentum? Simply, markets are in risk-on mode . The tariff agreements Trump is making with global partners are theoretically a positive element for risk-on assets, and we can see this from the rising price of the Nasdaq index. Since Bitcoin is now widely considered by the market as a risk-on asset, BTC demand is rising too. And I don‚Äôt see it as something strange or senseless: personally, I also distance myself from the Bitcoin = Safe haven asset parallel. On the contrary, I think the instit

HEADLINE: Bakkt offloads loyalty business to build $11M crypto treasury armory
SUMMARY: On Monday, crypto custody and trading firm Bakkt Holdings Inc. revealed it‚Äôs divesting its loyalty services arm to concentrate on core crypto infrastructure operations. The firm agreed to sell its loyalty business for $11 million to Project Labrador Holdco, LLC, an affiliate of Roman DBDR Technology Advisors, Inc. The deal is slated to close in Q3 of this year. Bakkt Holdings wants to focus on core infrastructure solutions Bakkt Holdings Inc. and Roman DBDR Technology Advisors have agreed on $11 million in cash, subject to working capital and debt adjustments, plus a short-term restricted cash loan to support the transition. Andy Main, Bakkt‚Äôs president and co-CEO, commented on the deal, saying , ‚ÄúWith the pending sale of our Loyalty business, we‚Äôre taking a clear step toward becoming a leaner, crypto-first company.‚Äù The company also insisted that its new arrangement will allow it to dedicate resources to core crypto offerings and the stablecoin payments infrastructure. Earlier this year, the firm had hinted at plans to sell its loyalty division after it confirmed the non-renewals from two major clients‚ÄîBank of America for loyalty services and Webull for crypto services. The two institutions‚Äô decision, however, consequently triggered a sharp selloff, causing Bakkt‚Äôs shares to drop over 27% in just one day. Investors even criticized the firm for failing to disclose the fragility of its revenue model. Some filed a lawsuit against the company, claiming it did not reveal the full extent of its financial dependence on the two major clients. The suit names several top Bakkt executives, including former CEO Gavin Michael, current CEO Andrew Main, and interim CFO Karen Alexander. Bank of America accounted for roughly 16% of Bakkt‚Äôs loyalty service revenue in 2023, and Webull, 74% of Bakkt‚Äôs crypto service revenue in 2024. Meanwhile, in June, Bakkt sought to raise up to $1 billion through various securities offerings, with some funds set for Bitcoin (BTC) purchases. Moreover, in its latest update, the firm projected Q2 crypto revenues between $568 million and $569 million and outlined plans for a capital raise via a public offering of Class A shares and/or pre-funded warrants. The company hopes to raise about $75 million to support digital asset acquisitions, working capital, and operational costs. The offering is expected to close on Wednesday. Akshay Naheta, who became co-CEO in March, also said the company intends to implement agentic AI solutions to enhance its crypto and stablecoin products and will aggressively execute its treasury strategy. Bakkt has been grappling with financial issues since 2021 In 2024, there was speculation that Trump Media & Technology Group wanted to acquire the company, which ultimately drove the company‚Äôs stock rally of over 160% . However, the two companies never confirmed the deal. However, the company has openly been struggling with liquidity problems, and its stock has dwindled since 2021, despite realigning its business toward crypto custody and trading services. A February disclosure showed it lacked sufficient capital to sustain operations for the next 12 months. Furthermore, on Monday, Bakkt Holdings (BKKT) shares closed nearly 5% lower and dropped an additional 27.8% in after-hours trading to $12.40, deepening its year-to-date loss to nearly 31%. HEADLINE: Trump‚Äôs July 30 Crypto Report to Back Stablecoins, Rejects CBDCs, Eyes Bitcoin Reserve
SUMMARY: Presidential Working Group to deliver comprehensive digital asset policy report. Framework bans retail CBDCs while promoting USD-backed stablecoin adoption. Strategic Bitcoin reserve and token classification guidance are expected in the document. President Donald Trump‚Äôs highly anticipated digital asset policy report will be released on July 30, meeting the 180-day mandate of his January 23 Executive Order to strengthen American leadership in digital financial technology. The comprehensive framework promises to transform federal cryptocurrency regulation by incorporating pro-innovation principles. The Presidential Working Group on Digital Asset Markets, directed by Special Advisor David Sacks, has developed suggestions for regulatory control, market structure, and consumer protection. The research was released after Trump rescinded Biden‚Äôs 2022 digital asset executive order. Report To Outline Clear Regulatory Boundaries The framework explicitly bans the creation or endorsement of a US central bank digital currency while encouraging lawful access to open public blockchain networks. This position contrasts sharply with previous administration approaches ‚Ä¶ The post Trump‚Äôs July 30 Crypto Report to Back Stablecoins, Rejects CBDCs, Eyes Bitcoin Reserve appeared first on Coin Edition .

HEADLINE: Antelope Enterprise‚Äôs Bold Bitcoin Investment: A Game-Changing $50M Strategy
SUMMARY: BitcoinWorld Antelope Enterprise‚Äôs Bold Bitcoin Investment: A Game-Changing $50M Strategy The world of corporate finance just got a jolt! In a move that‚Äôs sending ripples across the digital asset landscape, Antelope Enterprise Holdings, an established energy supply business, has announced a monumental financial agreement. This isn‚Äôt just any deal; it‚Äôs a strategic pivot towards the future of finance, with a clear focus on a significant Bitcoin investment . This bold step highlights a growing trend of traditional companies embracing cryptocurrencies, signaling a potential shift in how corporate treasuries manage their assets. Antelope Enterprise‚Äôs Visionary Bitcoin Investment: A Strategic Leap? Antelope Enterprise Holdings, primarily known for its operations in the energy sector, has recently inked a transformative deal with Streeterville Capital. This agreement secures up to $50 million in financing, earmarked specifically for the acquisition of Bitcoin (BTC). The funds will be drawn in tranches over a 24-month period, allowing Antelope Enterprise to strategically purchase BTC as market conditions dictate. This flexible approach underscores a careful consideration of market volatility and a commitment to optimizing their Bitcoin investment strategy. This isn‚Äôt just about adding a new asset to the balance sheet; it‚Äôs about making a statement. For an energy supply business to commit such substantial capital to a digital asset like Bitcoin speaks volumes about the perceived long-term value and stability of cryptocurrency. It positions Antelope Enterprise not just as an energy provider, but as a forward-thinking entity embracing the digital revolution. Unpacking the $50 Million Bitcoin Acquisition Strategy The details of the financing agreement reveal a methodical approach to this substantial Bitcoin investment . Here‚Äôs a closer look at the key aspects: Total Financing: Up to $50 million. Funding Source: Streeterville Capital. Disbursement: Drawn in tranches over a 24-month period. This allows for dollar-cost averaging, mitigating the risk of large single-point purchases in a volatile market. Exclusive Use: Funds are solely for Bitcoin acquisition. This specificity removes ambiguity and reinforces the strategic intent behind the move. Market-Dependent Purchases: Acquisitions will occur ‚Äúas market conditions allow,‚Äù indicating a flexible and opportunistic strategy rather than a rigid schedule. This adaptability is crucial in the dynamic crypto market. This structured approach suggests a well-thought-out plan rather than a speculative gamble. It allows Antelope Enterprise to capitalize on potential dips in Bitcoin‚Äôs price while spreading their risk over an extended period. This kind of calculated entry is often lauded as a prudent strategy for long-term digital asset accumulation. Why is Antelope Enterprise Betting Big on Bitcoin? The decision by a traditional energy company to make such a significant Bitcoin investment isn‚Äôt arbitrary. Several compelling factors likely influenced Antelope Enterprise‚Äôs strategic shift: Inflation Hedge: With global economic uncertainties and rising inflation, Bitcoin is increasingly viewed as a store of value, akin to digital gold. Its finite supply of 21 million coins makes it inherently deflationary, protecting purchasing power over time. Diversification of Treasury Assets: Traditional corporate treasuries often hold cash and low-yield bonds. Adding Bitcoin offers a new avenue for diversification, potentially enhancing overall portfolio returns and reducing correlation with traditional markets. Growth Potential: Despite its volatility, Bitcoin has historically shown remarkable growth over the long term. Companies like MicroStrategy have demonstrated the potential for substantial returns from holding BTC. Antelope Enterprise could be aiming to replicate this success. Embracing Innovation: Aligning with cutting-edge technologies and digital trends can enhance a company‚Äôs image and attract new talent and investors. It signals a forward-thinking leadership willing to adapt to the evolving financial landscape. Strategic Alignment: While an energy company, there‚Äôs a growing nexus between energy, sustainable practices, and Bitcoin mining. This investment could be a precursor to broader involvement in the digital asset ecosystem. This move reflects a growing confidence among corporations in Bitcoin‚Äôs long-term viability and its role in the future of finance. It‚Äôs a testament to Bitcoin‚Äôs maturing narrative beyond just a speculative asset. Potential Impacts of Corporate Bitcoin Investment on the Market When a company like Antelope Enterprise announces a $50 million Bitcoin investment , it sends ripples through the crypto market and beyond. What could be the potential consequences? Increased Institutional Adoption: Every new corporate treasury adding Bitcoin strengthens the narrative of institutional adoption. This can encourage other companies, both large and small, to consider similar m

HEADLINE: $754,000,000,000 Asset Management Giant Predicts Surging US Stocks Amid Improving Macro Backdrop ‚Äì ‚ÄòWall of Worry‚Äô Will Be Climbed
SUMMARY: An asset manager overseeing $754 billion in wealth believes that the next month or so will be bullish for the US stock market, despite investor skepticism. In a new interview on CNBC Television, Lauren Goodwin, the chief market strategist at New York Life Investments, says stocks are likely to print new highs in the coming weeks amid an improving macroeconomic landscape. The analyst believes early Q2 pessimism is now flipping into market momentum. ‚ÄúThe next three to four weeks, I think are full steam ahead, for the equity market in particular. That‚Äôs because not only has Q2 economic reality been much better than analysts were expecting at the beginning of the quarter ‚Äì just many of the worst-case scenario risks have not materialized and are not likely to materialize over the next few weeks. So earnings are likely to be quite strong again. But the backdrop as well, as we think ahead, related to deregulation, related to the supply-chain reglobalization that‚Äôs happening supporting the AI (artificial intelligence) supply chain in particular, that‚Äôs supportive of market broadening as well, and we‚Äôve seen some of that breadth. Even in weaker market days, you haven‚Äôt seen a big rotation into the defensives. And so, I think the market will continue to climb this wall of worry in the near term.‚Äù New York Life Investments is a New Jersey-based asset manager serving institutional and retail investors across multiple asset classes, including fixed income, equity and alternative investments. HEADLINE: Urgent Alert: Bitcoin Price Plummets Below $118,000 ‚Äì What‚Äôs Next?
SUMMARY: BitcoinWorld Urgent Alert: Bitcoin Price Plummets Below $118,000 ‚Äì What‚Äôs Next? The cryptocurrency market is once again sending ripples through the financial world as Bitcoin (BTC) experiences a significant Bitcoin price drop , falling below the crucial $118,000 mark. According to real-time market monitoring, BTC is currently trading at approximately $117,994.22 on major exchanges like Binance USDT market. This sudden downturn has left many investors questioning the immediate future of the digital asset and what strategies they should consider. This comprehensive guide aims to unpack the reasons behind this latest market movement, offer historical context, and provide actionable insights for navigating these volatile times. Whether you are a seasoned trader or a new entrant to the crypto space, understanding the dynamics of a Bitcoin price drop is essential for making informed decisions. Unpacking the Reasons Behind the Bitcoin Price Drop When a digital asset as prominent as Bitcoin experiences a sharp decline, it‚Äôs rarely due to a single factor. The current Bitcoin price drop is likely the confluence of several interconnected elements, ranging from macroeconomic pressures to specific market behaviors. Understanding these underlying causes is crucial for investors looking to make sense of the volatility. Macroeconomic Headwinds: A Global Impact on Bitcoin Price The broader global economic landscape often casts a long shadow over the cryptocurrency market. Factors such as persistent inflation, rising interest rates, and geopolitical tensions can significantly influence investor sentiment and capital allocation. When traditional markets show signs of instability, investors often de-risk, pulling funds from more volatile assets like cryptocurrencies. This ‚Äòflight to safety‚Äô can exert downward pressure on the Bitcoin price , as investors seek refuge in less volatile assets like government bonds or the US dollar. The anticipation of further interest rate hikes by central banks, for instance, can make riskier assets less attractive, contributing to sell-offs. Regulatory Uncertainty: Shaping the Future of BTC Price The evolving regulatory environment also plays a pivotal role in the cryptocurrency market. Announcements or rumors of new regulations, stricter enforcement, or outright bans in certain jurisdictions can trigger widespread panic and lead to a rapid Bitcoin price drop . Governments worldwide are grappling with how to classify and oversee digital assets, and their decisions can have profound effects on market liquidity and investor confidence. Ambiguity surrounding these policies can deter institutional investors and create an atmosphere of caution among retail traders, leading to selling pressure. Whale Activity and Market Dynamics: Influencing the Bitcoin Price Trajectory The cryptocurrency market is heavily influenced by ‚Äòwhales‚Äô ‚Äì large holders of Bitcoin who can move significant amounts of capital. A large sell-off by a whale or a group of whales can instantly flood the market with supply, causing the Bitcoin price to plummet. These large transactions can trigger automated stop-loss orders from smaller traders, creating a cascade effect that exacerbates the downward trend. Furthermore, the overall market sentiment, driven by fear, uncertainty, and doubt (FUD) or exuberance (FOMO), can amplify these movements, leading to rapid price swings. Technical Indicators and Support Levels: What the Charts Say About the Bitcoin Price For many traders, technical analysis provides crucial insights into potential price movements. The $118,000 level may have been identified as a significant support level by technical analysts. When such a critical support level is breached, it often signals further downside potential, triggering more sell orders as traders adjust their positions. This self-fulfilling prophecy can accelerate a Bitcoin price drop , as algorithms and human traders react to the broken thresholds. Key indicators like moving averages, relative strength index (RSI), and trading volumes are closely watched for signs of a reversal or continuation of a trend. What Does This Bitcoin Price Drop Mean for Your Portfolio? A sudden decline in the Bitcoin price can be unsettling, especially for those new to the market‚Äôs inherent volatility. However, understanding its implications is key to reacting rationally rather than emotionally. Navigating Volatility: The Inevitable Side of Bitcoin Price Swings Volatility is a hallmark of the cryptocurrency market, and a Bitcoin price drop is not an anomaly but rather a recurring feature. While it can lead to temporary paper losses, it also tests investors‚Äô conviction and long-term strategy. Panic selling often locks in losses and prevents participation in subsequent recoveries. It‚Äôs crucial to remember that past performance does not guarantee future results, but historical data shows Bitcoin‚Äôs remarkable resilience over the long term, recovering from numerous significant corr

HEADLINE: D2X raises $5 million as EU race for compliant crypto derivatives heats up
SUMMARY: Amsterdam-based crypto exchange D2X has raised ‚Ç¨4.3 million ($5 million) in fresh capital as demand accelerates for regulated crypto derivatives across Europe. The round, led by CMT Digital, Circle Ventures, and Canton Ventures, reinforces D2X‚Äôs strategy to provide a MiFID II-compliant venue for institutional clients seeking exposure to Bitcoin and Ethereum derivatives. The funding was first reported by Silicon Canals . The investment follows last year‚Äôs ‚Ç¨9.1 million Series A and comes at a time when traditional financial players are increasingly exploring digital asset markets. With a Multilateral Trading Facility (MTF) licence granted by the Dutch Authority for Financial Markets (AFM), D2X is among the first in the EU to offer a legally recognised path for institutional crypto derivatives trading. Capital support expands beyond new backers The latest fundraising round saw follow-on participation from prominent names including Point72 Ventures, Tioga Capital, GSR, and Fortino Capital. These investors had backed the firm‚Äôs 2023 Series A round, which was key to D2X becoming the first crypto exchange in the European Union to secure a MiFID-compliant MTF licence. The fresh ‚Ç¨4.3 million will help D2X build out its product suite and speed up the onboarding process for Tier-1 institutions. Its platform currently supports USD- and EUR-denominated Bitcoin and Ethereum futures. Options contracts are also expected to launch soon. Institutional demand for regulatory clarity and seven-day trading infrastructure has been growing. D2X‚Äôs architecture is tailored to accommodate the 24/7 nature of crypto markets while remaining in line with European financial compliance norms. Focus on dollar-settled crypto futures A major addition to D2X‚Äôs offering is its recent launch of USD-based futures for BTC and ETH. These contracts cater specifically to institutions requiring dollar-settled instruments and seek exposure through regulated channels. With real-time USD exposure, MiFID II oversight, and a weekend-ready setup, D2X is positioning itself as a key player in Europe‚Äôs evolving crypto derivatives market. The exchange‚Äôs ability to serve institutional clients without routing them to offshore venues marks a distinct competitive edge. The firm was founded by Theodore Rozencwajg, Don van der Krogt, and Laetitia Grimaud. Its primary focus remains building infrastructure to support compliant access to digital asset derivatives in Europe. Coinbase ramps up US offering for retail traders The European expansion by D2X parallels a broader regulatory shift happening in the United States. Coinbase, the largest US-based exchange, launched CFTC-regulated nano Bitcoin and Ethereum perpetual futures last week. These products allow retail traders to access up to 10x leverage in a fully regulated environment. Offered through Coinbase Financial Markets, the contracts are settled in USD and mirror the characteristics of traditional perpetual futures, including five-year expirations and hourly funding rates. The offering is available 24/7 and charges low taker fees starting at 0.02%. Historically, retail traders in the US have been pushed to unregulated offshore platforms for derivatives trading. Coinbase‚Äôs latest move aligns with Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) standards, creating a compliant alternative to riskier venues. Institutions seek safety and structure in digital markets Both D2X and Coinbase are responding to an uptick in institutional and retail interest for safe, regulated crypto derivatives. With MiFID II regulation in Europe and CFTC compliance in the US, the trend points towards a more structured future for digital asset trading. The race to capture this demand is unfolding on both sides of the Atlantic. While D2X focuses on institutional clients in Europe, Coinbase is targeting retail investors in the US, each leveraging regulatory clarity to build long-term trading infrastructure. The post D2X raises $5 million as EU race for compliant crypto derivatives heats up appeared first on Invezz

HEADLINE: Standard Chartered Announces Ethereum (ETH) Price Forecast! Should We Expect a Rise or a Fall?
SUMMARY: Ethereum (ETH) has made a big breakout in recent weeks and is taking firm steps towards its new ATH. At this point, Ethereum has fallen to the $3,800 level after hitting a seven-month high of $3,940. It is now expected to surpass the key $4,000 resistance level. While the market is generally expecting higher levels, maintaining Ethereum‚Äôs upward momentum, a new analysis has come from Standard Chartered. According to Coindesk, Standard Chartered analyst Geoff Kendrick stated that Ethereum (ETH) will continue its rise thanks to the increase in institutional demand. Stating that institutional investors are turning from Bitcoin to Ethereum due to regulatory restrictions, the analyst stated that if institutional ETH purchases continue, it could surpass the key resistance level of $4,000, which is their current estimate for the end of 2025. The bank also noted in the report that institutional treasuries have purchased 1% of all Ethereum in circulation since the beginning of June. He added that Standard Chartered estimates ETH treasury holdings could reach 10% of the supply due to staking returns and DeFi access. ‚ÄúUnlike Bitcoin, Ethereum treasuries offer yields from staking rewards, currently around 3%, and decentralized finance (DeFi) leverage opportunities, giving them a structural advantage over BTC treasuries. This regulatory arbitrage makes Ethereum an increasingly attractive asset for publicly traded companies looking to hold digital assets on their balance sheets, especially in jurisdictions where direct crypto access is limited.‚Äù *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Standard Chartered Announces Ethereum (ETH) Price Forecast! Should We Expect a Rise or a Fall?

HEADLINE: Bitcoin: Unveiling Its Crucial Role as a Hedge Against the U.S. Deficit
SUMMARY: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin: Unveiling Its Crucial Role as a Hedge Against the U.S. Deficit In a surprising turn that has captivated the financial world, CNBC‚Äôs Mad Money host Jim Cramer, a figure often associated with skepticism towards cryptocurrencies, has publicly declared that ‚ÄòBitcoin is a hedge against the U.S. budget deficit.‚Äô This bold statement marks a significant shift in perception from a mainstream financial commentator, highlighting a growing acknowledgment of Bitcoin‚Äôs potential role in global economics. For anyone keenly observing the evolving landscape of digital assets, this endorsement suggests a deeper narrative unfolding around the utility of a Bitcoin hedge in an increasingly uncertain economic climate. Why is Jim Cramer Calling Bitcoin a ‚ÄòBitcoin Hedge‚Äô? Jim Cramer‚Äôs recent comments, as reported by U.Today, signal a notable evolution in his stance on Bitcoin. Historically, Cramer has been known for his cautious, sometimes even critical, views on cryptocurrencies. His latest pronouncement, however, positions Bitcoin not merely as a speculative asset but as a strategic financial instrument. But what exactly prompted this change of heart, and why does he see Bitcoin as a viable Bitcoin hedge against something as fundamental as the U.S. budget deficit? Economic Hardship and Political Instability: Cramer posits that Bitcoin could offer a shield for nations and individuals against the adverse effects of economic hardship and political instability. A ballooning national debt can lead to inflation, currency devaluation, and a loss of confidence in traditional financial systems. In such scenarios, an asset that operates outside government control and traditional banking infrastructure gains appeal. Decentralization and Scarcity: Unlike fiat currencies, which can be printed in unlimited quantities by central banks, Bitcoin has a capped supply of 21 million coins. This inherent scarcity, combined with its decentralized nature, makes it resistant to inflationary pressures and political manipulation, characteristics that are highly desirable in a hedging asset. A Personal Anecdote: Cramer reinforced his argument by recalling the story of an anonymous worker who, five years ago, purchased Bitcoin when it was trading under $50,000. This individual now enjoys financial freedom, a testament to Bitcoin‚Äôs long-term appreciation. Such stories, while anecdotal, resonate deeply and illustrate the transformative potential of early adoption, underscoring the power of a strategic Bitcoin hedge . Understanding the U.S. Budget Deficit: A Backdrop for the Bitcoin Hedge Argument To fully grasp the significance of Cramer‚Äôs statement, it‚Äôs crucial to understand the context of the U.S. budget deficit. The budget deficit occurs when government expenditures exceed its revenues, leading to an accumulation of national debt. Persistent and large deficits can have several profound economic implications: Inflationary Pressures: Governments often finance deficits by borrowing or, in some cases, by increasing the money supply. The latter can lead to inflation, eroding the purchasing power of a currency and devaluing savings. Currency Devaluation: A country with a large and growing debt may see its currency weaken against others, making imports more expensive and potentially reducing the nation‚Äôs economic standing on the global stage. Economic Instability: High levels of debt can lead to higher interest rates, reduced government spending flexibility, and increased risk of economic crises, potentially impacting everything from employment to investment. In this environment, investors and nations seek assets that can preserve value and offer stability. Gold has traditionally served this role, but Cramer‚Äôs argument suggests Bitcoin is emerging as a digital alternative, providing a modern form of a Bitcoin hedge . Beyond the National Level: Bitcoin as a Personal ‚ÄòBitcoin Hedge‚Äô While Cramer‚Äôs focus was on nations, the concept of Bitcoin as a hedge extends powerfully to individuals. For many, the idea of a Bitcoin hedge against personal financial hardship or the erosion of savings due to inflation is highly compelling. Decentralization Operates outside government or central bank control, reducing political risk and censorship. Global Accessibility Can be accessed and transferred anywhere in the world, offering financial sovereignty, especially in regions with unstable local currencies. Divisibility Can be divided into tiny units (satoshi), making it accessible for investments of all sizes. The anonymous worker‚Äôs story is a vivid example of this personal hedge in action. HEADLINE: Coinbase Adds Samsung Pay for Seamless Crypto Purchases
SUMMARY: Coinbase has rolled out Samsung Pay as a new payment option, making it simpler for clients in the U.S. and Canada to buy crypto straight from their phones. Coinbase Integrates Samsung PayThis update lets users fund their accounts directly through the Coinbase app using Samsung Pay, without needing to switch apps or re-enter payment information. The feature has already started reaching some users across North America, with full availability expected in the coming weeks, according to a press release today.With this partnership with Samsung, Coinbase combines its secure platform with the convenience of one of the world''s leading mobile wallets. Specifically, users with Samsung Pay can now move from browsing to buying crypto in just a few taps.¬†https://twitter.com/coinbase/status/1950201337720836360The goal is to make the process feel as natural as sending a message or tapping to pay at checkout, especially as the crypto scene continues to attract new entrants.Growing Global Crypto Adoption Demands Easier OnboardingNotably, the latest trends in 2025 show just how fast crypto adoption is growing. Per recent reports , around 28% of American adults, roughly 65 million people, now own some form of digital asset, nearly double the number from 2021.¬†Meanwhile, among those who haven''t yet entered the space, 14% plan to buy this year, while 67% of current owners want to grow their holdings. Interestingly, Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Dogecoin lead the list of coins drawing the most interest.Globally, more than 824 million people now hold digital assets, with Bitcoin in the lead and owned by about 5% of the world''s population. Reports point to a strong price growth, more institutional involvement, and easier ways to invest as the drivers of this surge.¬†Also, consumer sentiment keeps trending positive. About 60% of Americans familiar with crypto believe prices will rise, with many pointing to political developments as a key influence.This growing momentum shows why Coinbase continues to improve its user experience. With Samsung Pay now in the mix, both first-time buyers and experienced investors can fund their accounts faster and more easily. Last month, Coinbase sought SEC approval to offer stock trading on blockchain.Coinbase Increasingly Integrating Mobile WalletsThis isn''t Coinbase''s first step into mobile wallet partnerships. The company added Google Pay support to its Coinbase Card in March 2020, giving Android users the ability to spend crypto via tap-to-pay.¬†Later that year, Coinbase expanded Google Pay integration to include direct crypto purchases. Also, Apple Pay joined the lineup in June 2021 for the Coinbase Card, and in December 2024, Coinbase allowed direct crypto buys through Apple Pay using its Onramp feature.Meanwhile, Coinbase is the latest to integrate Samsung Pay among crypto exchange and trading platforms. For instance, Alchemy Pay connected its virtual crypto cards with Samsung Pay in October 2024, opening the door for more than 500,000 users across 24 countries to make purchases using crypto, both online and in-store.¬†In another instance, Gemini teamed up with Samsung''s Blockchain Wallet, giving Galaxy users the option to buy, sell, and trade crypto straight from the Gemini app by April 2025.
TAGS: Market|Coinbase News Today|Latest Crypto Exchanges News

HEADLINE: A 2035 Vision: Will Bitcoin Hit the Million-Dollar Milestone?
SUMMARY: As Bitcoin begins its third decade of existence, investors and enthusiasts around the globe are struggling with one breathtaking question: How much will one Bitcoin be worth in 2035? Ten years from now, as cryptocurrencies are deeply woven into the texture of finance and technology, long-term targets for the world''s biggest virtual asset are both ambitious and hotly debated. Consensus 2025: Million-Dollar Bitcoin Enters Mainstream Predictions being taken with grains of salt and all, one thing is sure: most forecasts up until 2025 are in agreement that the value of Bitcoin as of 2035 might be historical, even a record-breaker. Numerous comprehensive surveys point to $1 million per Bitcoin as a default scenario for 2035, with some projections even surpassing that. A July 2025 report by Finder that polled 24 cryptocurrency researchers and analysts estimates the average price of Bitcoin at the end of 2035 to be $1.02 million. It is not an outlier: many other models and reports‚Äîranging from mainstream financial news outlets to technical and adoption-based analysis‚Äîagree on this seven-figure number, and some estimate prices even higher for the same timeline, to $1.3‚Äì1.8 million or even more. What''s Behind the Mega-Bullish Estimates? Institutional and Governmental Adoption Among the biggest tailwinds behind Bitcoin''s price potential is growing institutional and even national adoption. Over the last five years, giant corporations, hedge funds, and even nation-states have come to accumulate Bitcoin as a treasury reserve asset. Panelists in long-range forecasts cite this ever-broadening base of ‚Äùstrong hands‚Äù ‚Äì entities that buy for the long haul ‚Äì repeatedly as one of the most potent forces pushing the price higher. ‚ÄùAs governments continue to print fiat money at unsustainably high levels, people will look for alternative ways of storing value. Gold has been a store of value for centuries and bitcoin is a better version of gold,‚Äù one industry expert said. Bitcoin as ‚ÄùDigital Gold‚Äù Most analysts think Bitcoin will ultimately outrank or at least match gold''s aggregate market capitalization‚Äîa situation that alone would justify a $1 million plus valuation per coin. This ‚Äùdigital gold‚Äù narrative is held commonly now by investors from Wall Street to sovereign wealth funds, so fresh capital may increase consistently over the next ten years, particularly if macroeconomic uncertainty or inflationary pressures continue. Scarcity and Halving Cycles Bitcoin''s inherent monetary quality‚Äîits fixed supply of 21 million coins‚Äînever changes, and periodic ‚Äùhalving‚Äù diminishes new supply over time. By 2035, the number of new-issue bitcoins minted each year will have declined considerably, further enhancing scarcity and price pressure. Technological Maturity and Utility The Bitcoin network will be more powerful, with superior transaction layers, increased processing power, and widespread adoption across financial products. Mainstream adoption may be less volatile and more due to actual economic usage if there is more secure and efficient infrastructure. Dissent and Conservative Models There has been a broadly bullish view, but some experts propose more conservative estimates by pointing out the maturing but still volatile state of crypto markets. For instance, Kraken''s model of projection‚Äîrunning on a steady 5% annual rate of growth‚Äîplaces Bitcoin in 2035 at around $194,000, a life-altering leap but still far from the million-dollar club. These more pessimistic models rather point to risk factors such as regulatory crackdowns, innovations that could supplant Bitcoin''s popularity, or a root change in investor sentiment if newer crypto assets become dominant. What Could Go Wrong? Risks and Uncertainties Macroeconomic shocks, likely legislation on cryptocurrencies, or widespread adoption of alternative technologies might all disturb these estimates. Some doomsayers, though minority in number, foresee Bitcoin moving ‚Äùa speculative bubble‚Äù or mention market manipulation and sustainability concerns as possible threats to its price trajectory. Down the line, the crypto evangelists'' prevailing refrain is one of hope: Bitcoin in 2035 will be far more mainstream, liquid, and internationally networked than ever before. Its ability to store and move value independent of government-dominated money might make it a linchpin component of ‚Äùdigital nation‚Äù infrastructure. If these best-case scenarios come to pass, owning even a small percentage of a Bitcoin in 2035 could be an investment triumph like owning headline tech shares early in the internet era. In summary : The consensus 2035 price prediction for Bitcoin is at or higher than $1 million per coin, driven by institutional adoption, macro drivers, digital scarcity, and maturing market infrastructure as the primary drivers of growth. There are qualifiers and skeptics, but the next decade will likely be the most consequential chapter yet in the remarkable story of Bitcoin.

HEADLINE: VC CEO Backs XRP as Global Reserve Bridge ‚Äì Bitcoin Hyper Could Soar Next
SUMMARY: Oliver Michel, CEO of Tokentus Investment‚Äîone of Germany‚Äôs leading venture capital firms‚Äîbelieves $XRP could dethrone the U.S. dollar as the ultimate global reserve bridge. In his view, XRP isn‚Äôt just another altcoin; it‚Äôs the strongest candidate to link global currencies and power seamless cross-border transactions at massive scale. The idea of a crypto asset replacing the world‚Äôs dominant fiat currency is nothing short of game-changing. If this vision comes to life, it could ignite a wave of retail and institutional adoption, fueling unprecedented growth across the entire Web3 ecosystem. This bold prediction also underscores a bigger truth: the world needs crypto projects that can disrupt entrenched financial systems. Enter Bitcoin Hyper , a next-gen Layer 2 network that‚Äôs pushing the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible on Bitcoin‚Äîand shaping the future of decentralized finance. Hyperscale Data to Scoop Up $10M $XRP Michel‚Äôs bold statement hasn‚Äôt come from thin air; real-world moves are already casting a light on $XRP‚Äôs potential. At the centre of the coin‚Äôs success is Ripple‚Äôs On-Demand Liquidity (ODL) system. It leverages $XRP as a bridge currency to facilitate instant, cost-friendly border payments without the need for pre-funded accounts in international countries. So it‚Äôs no wonder major firms are taking notice of the asset. Just this week, shares of Hyperscale Data (GPUS) jumped by over 12% after it announced plans to scoop up $10M $XRP as part of its digital asset strategy. Like Michel, Hyper Scale views $XRP as a ‚Äò foundational asset in the evolving global financial ecosystem .‚Äô The company also plans to publish weekly updates on its $XRP holdings starting August 12. It is also considering a 36-month lockup for its reserves, which is a decisive vote of long-term confidence in the asset. To top it off, Coinglass data shows $2B+ in $XRP futures open interest on Bitget and nearly $4B in trade volume on Binance‚Äîboth of which are clear signals of confidence and soaring market activity around $XRP. Such positive news comes despite the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) recently temporarily halting the launch of a multi-asset ETF that included $XRP. Still, hope isn‚Äôt fading. According to Polymarket data, analysts predict an 86% chance that a Ripple ETF will be approved this year. The buzz around $XRP reveals a bigger reality: crypto is evolving at lightning speed, and the ultimate winners won‚Äôt just ride hype, they‚Äôll solve real-world financial roadblocks. While $XRP attracts attention over transforming cross-border payments, $HYPER is gearing up to reshape Bitcoin‚Äôs foundation through Bitcoin Hyper . Bitcoin Hyper to Boost Bitcoin With Solana‚Äôs Speed Bitcoin Hyper ($HYPER) goes beyond being just another Bitcoin Layer 2; it‚Äôs the infrastructure needed to revamp Bitcoin as blockchain interest rockets. Set to launch in Q3 2025, it aims to shatter Bitcoin‚Äôs biggest limitations‚Äîeliminating slow transactions, slashing fees, and finally unlocking smart contract capabilities. To achieve this, it‚Äôll integrate the Solana Virtual Machine (SVM) . By doing so, it can match the Solana network‚Äôs speed and cost-efficiency. The Layer 2 upgrade will also unlock powerful features, including high-performance dApps, real-world asset tokenization, and even launches of the best meme coins . At the core of the ecosystem is a Canonical Bridge . It‚Äôll allow $BTC to move easily between Bitcoin 1 and Layer 2. This way, you can benefit from Bitcoin‚Äôs security while enjoying the speed and flexibility of modern smart contracts. To truly maximize Bitcoin Hyper‚Äôs potential, you‚Äôll need $HYPER, its native token. Holding it unlocks governance power, ultra-low gas fees, and hefty staking rewards‚Äîcurrently boasting an impressive 181% APY. Since launching in May 2025, $HYPER has already snagged over $5M on presale. Investors have long-term confidence in the project, as evidenced by three whale buyers funneling $74.9K , $54.1K , and $10K into the project early on. Cryptos Solving Real Financial Problems Attract Attention The buzz around $XRP potentially replacing the U.S. dollar as the world‚Äôs first reserve currency proves that crypto has moved beyond pure hype‚Äîit‚Äôs now about fixing real financial inefficiencies. While $XRP eyes a dominant role in global finance, Bitcoin Hyper is preparing to breathe new life into Bitcoin itself, introducing next-level programmability and utility. With interest building and strong early backing, Bitcoin Hyper could be the next crypto to explode . You can grab $HYPER on presale for as little as $0.01245. Given the Layer 2‚Äôs launch is expected to propel it to $0.32 , now could be the perfect time to do precisely that for possible ~2,470% returns. This isn‚Äôt investment advice. DYOR and never invest more than you‚Äôd be sad to lose.

The buzz around $XRP reveals a bigger reality: crypto is evolving at lightning speed, and the ultimate winners won‚Äôt just ride hype, they‚Äôll solve real-world financial roadblocks. While $XRP attracts attention over transforming cross-border payments, $HYPER is gearing up to reshape Bitcoin‚Äôs foundation through Bitcoin Hyper . Bitcoin Hyper to Boost Bitcoin With Solana‚Äôs Speed Bitcoin Hyper ($HYPER) goes beyond being just another Bitcoin Layer 2; it‚Äôs the infrastructure needed to revamp Bitcoin as blockchain interest rockets. Set to launch in Q3 2025, it aims to shatter Bitcoin‚Äôs biggest limitations‚Äîeliminating slow transactions, slashing fees, and finally unlocking smart contract capabilities. To achieve this, it‚Äôll integrate the Solana Virtual Machine (SVM) . By doing so, it can match the Solana network‚Äôs speed and cost-efficiency. The Layer 2 upgrade will also unlock powerful features, including high-performance dApps, real-world asset tokenization, and even launches of the best meme coins . At the core of the ecosystem is a Canonical Bridge . It‚Äôll allow $BTC to move easily between Bitcoin 1 and Layer 2. This way, you can benefit from Bitcoin‚Äôs security while enjoying the speed and flexibility of modern smart contracts. To truly maximize Bitcoin Hyper‚Äôs potential, you‚Äôll need $HYPER, its native token. Holding it unlocks governance power, ultra-low gas fees, and hefty staking rewards‚Äîcurrently boasting an impressive 181% APY. Since launching in May 2025, $HYPER has already snagged over $5M on presale. Investors have long-term confidence in the project, as evidenced by three whale buyers funneling $74.9K , $54.1K , and $10K into the project early on. Cryptos Solving Real Financial Problems Attract Attention The buzz around $XRP potentially replacing the U.S. dollar as the world‚Äôs first reserve currency proves that crypto has moved beyond pure hype‚Äîit‚Äôs now about fixing real financial inefficiencies. While $XRP eyes a dominant role in global finance, Bitcoin Hyper is preparing to breathe new life into Bitcoin itself, introducing next-level programmability and utility. With interest building and strong early backing, Bitcoin Hyper could be the next crypto to explode . You can grab $HYPER on presale for as little as $0.01245. Given the Layer 2‚Äôs launch is expected to propel it to $0.32 , now could be the perfect time to do precisely that for possible ~2,470% returns. This isn‚Äôt investment advice. DYOR and never invest more than you‚Äôd be sad to lose.
